io.jeo.util

Class XMLWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.jeo.util.XMLWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class XMLWriter
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Produces an XML document.

    Usage: 

    
 XMLWriter w = new XMLWriter();
 w.init(output).start("message").text("Hello World").end("message").close();
    The above would produce the following XML document: 
       <message>Hello World<message>
    .

    • Constructor Summary

      XMLWriter()
      Create an uninitialized WMLWriter.
      XMLWriter(Writer out)
      Create a XMLWriter initialized with the given Writer.

    • Method Detail

      • indent

        public XMLWriter indent(int size)
        Turns on indentation and sets the indent size.

        This method needs to be called prior to init(java.io.Writer).

        Parameters:
        size - The number of spaces to indent.

      • init

        public XMLWriter init(Writer writer)
        One form of init(java.io.Writer) must be invoked before use.
        Parameters:
        writer - non-null Writer to output to

      • init

        public XMLWriter init(OutputStream out)
        One form of init(java.io.Writer) must be invoked before use.
        Parameters:
        out - non-null OutputStream to output to

      • start

        public XMLWriter start(String name,
              Object... kv)
        Starts an element with the provided name and attribute key-value pairs.

        Whatever attributes that have been set via calling atts(Object...) will also be written out. The list of attributes will be cleared after this method is called.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the element to encode.
        kv - key-value pairs representing attributes, must be an even number.
        Returns:
        this

      • element

        public XMLWriter element(String name,
                Object value,
                Object... kv)
        Encodes a full element (start and end) with the specified name.

        This method is short hand for the following: 

        
     start(name, kv);
     text(value);
     end(name);

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the element.
        value - The text value of the element, null means no text content.
        kv - Attribute key-value pairs.

      • emptyElement

        public XMLWriter emptyElement(String name,
                     Object... kv)
        Encodes an element with no text content or children.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the element.
        kv - The attribute key value pairs.

      • text

        public XMLWriter text(Object value)
        Encodes text content.

        This method is called between start(String, Object...) and #end() invocations.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to encode as text, null makes this method a no-op.

      • end

        public XMLWriter end(String name)
        Ends the current element.

        This method must be called after start(String, Object...).

      • atts

        public XMLWriter atts(Object... kv)
        Add any attributes to use on the next invocation of start(String, Object...).
        Parameters:
        kv - An even number of key value attribute pairs.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
